column4: I have a laptop CQ42-170TX, I want to connect it with my external monitor BENQ 22". But in monitor resolution setting, the max res. is 1280x768 only, but my monitor can support 1920x1080
you need to add the mode manually because the monitors edid information is incomplete/incorrect
may I know how can I add it? I didn't have much knowledge about this.
i can't walk you through it, but i can tell you you use "cvt" and xrandr --newmode and then --addmode with its output
thanks, because in the old day, there is a x11.conf
are you using nvidias binary driver?
re: ati, i do not know if it does xrandr, if it doesn't you'll need to use xorg.conf or their control panel
thanks and I fixed my problem
are you using the native player or the one with nspluginwrapper? i've had much better luck with nspluginwrapper NOT in the picture
so you extracted and installed an .so yourself?
I think I install it using apt-get
ok then it is using nspluginwrapper, not native
I am sorry, I don't know about it
it says it is Adobe Flash player plugin installer
basically, nspluginwrapper is a huge pile of mess and compromise, and the native 64bit plugin is much better
